questions.question_text: Terraform providers are part of the Terraform core binary.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Terraform is logically split into two main parts: Terraform Core and Terraform Plugins. Terraform Core uses remote procedure calls (RPC) to communicate with Terraform Plugins, and offers multiple ways to discover and load plugins to use. Terraform Plugins expose an implementation for a specific service, such as AWS, or provisioner, such as bash.

Selected Answer: C
GUI is not benefit os IaC

Selected Answer: C
GUI is not one of the benefits of using IaC

questions.question_text: Which of the following is not a benefit of adopting infrastructure as code?
Where does the Terraform local backend store its state?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Stores the state in the terraform.tfstate file

questions.question_text: Which of these is true about Terraform's plugin-based architecture?

choices.D: All providers are part of the Terraform core binary
choices.C: Every provider in a configuration has its own state file for its resources
choices.B: You can create a provider for your API if none exists
choices.A: Terraform can only source providers from the internet

discussion.content:
Correct ans: B 
Terraform's plugin-based architecture allows users to create custom providers to manage resources that aren't supported by default Terraform providers.

Selected Answer: B
(B) is correct answer

choices.C: With an S3 module with proper settings for buckets
choices.A: Auditing cloud storage buckets with a vulnerability scanning tool
choices.B: With a Sentinel policy, which runs before every apply
choices.D: By adding variables to each Terraform Cloud workspace to ensure these settings are always enabled

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Sentinel will do this with PaC (Policy as Code)

questions.question_text: Your risk management organization requires that new AWS S3 buckets must be private and encrypted at rest. How can Terraform Cloud automatically and proactively enforce this security control?
